column5: Yesterday a good buddy and I headed out to Simcoe for some fishin.. We fished in about 93 feet of water and had 3 lakers on the ice in the first hour, all released.  We fished another 3 hours or so and caught 4 more, not too bad of a day, ended up taking one home.  The fish were tight to bottom.         Today we headed back out and I brought my brother and my dad.  The lake was WET today, lots of water on top and rushing into the holes and expanding them.  We all got fish today, nothing huge, but I did manage one nice laker, bigger than the rest.  93 feet again today, but the fish were 4-5 feet off bottom.
Great report and pics Steve  Those are some good looking lakers    congratulations to everyone Got to love it when you can catch them like that! Great job you guys!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
fun ride ,, you guys look like you had a great time ,,  good on ya!!  well done ,, nice lookin' lakers !
You sure get lucky with the lakers.........I haven't caught one for a while now. Lots of whities though  No whities for you guys??  Sinker
I'm fishing Simcoe Saturday and Sunday, so this is getting me pumped. Great report.
great report, wish i had time to get out for lakers
Nice catches as usual! I guess Simcoe has strong ice still judging by your trucks being out there.
Wanna trade?  LOL  We got a bunch of whities earlier in the week, in a different location.  I've got some pics on my phone, but they werent very impresive anyways haha.
There was a good 20 inches of black ice... with this weather, I think I'll be walking from now on.
